title: Sensing What Surveys Miss: Understanding and Personalizing Proactive LLM Support by User Modeling
relevance: Proactive LLM support through user modeling — directly maps to Seena's contextual micro-interview trigger logic and behavioral sensing.

title: InterFlow: Designing Unobtrusive AI to Empower Interviewers in Semi-Structured Interviews
relevance: AI-augmented interviewing with unobtrusive design — core to Seena's AI-powered interview methodology and real-time guidance system.

title: Behavioral Indicators of Overreliance During Interaction with Conversational Language Models
relevance: Behavioral signal detection in conversational AI — relevant to Seena's multi-dimensional session clustering and behavioral pattern recognition.

title: Qualitative Coding Analysis through Open-Source Large Language Models: A User Study and Design Recommendations
relevance: LLMs for qualitative coding — directly competitive/complementary to Seena's AI analysis pipeline. Key benchmarking reference.

title: Reflexis: Supporting Reflexivity and Rigor in Collaborative Qualitative Analysis through Design for Deliberation
relevance: Rigor in collaborative qual analysis — relevant to Seena's evidence traceability system and researcher-AI deliberation loops.

title: When Should Users Check? A Decision-Theoretic Model of Confirmation Frequency in Multi-Step AI Agent Tasks
relevance: Optimal human-AI handoff points — informs Seena's micro-interview timing and when to surface insights vs. keep collecting.

title: Interaction Context Often Increases Sycophancy in LLMs
relevance: Critical for Seena's interview AI — understanding how context biases LLM responses and designing against sycophantic agreement in micro-interviews.

title: Designing Computational Tools for Exploring Causal Relationships in Qualitative Data
relevance: Causal reasoning in qualitative data — maps to Seena's insight extraction and how behavioral clusters connect to product decisions.

title: CritiqueCrew: Orchestrating Multi-Perspective Conversational Design Critique
relevance: Multi-agent design critique from different expert perspectives — maps directly to Seena's multi-agent research pipeline architecture.

title: Perspectra: Choosing Your Experts Enhances Critical Thinking in Multi-Agent Research Ideation
relevance: User-configurable expert agent selection improves critical thinking — informs how Seena lets researchers choose which analytical lenses agents apply.

title: Hear You in Silence: Designing for Active Listening in Human Interaction with Conversational Agents Using Context-Aware Pacing
relevance: Context-aware conversational pacing that makes agents feel like active listeners — core interaction design for Seena's voice-based research interviews.

title: PointAloud: An Interaction Suite for AI-Supported Pointer-Centric Think-Aloud Computing
relevance: AI-supported think-aloud methodology in real time — essential reference for Seena's upcoming think-aloud research tool.
note: Key reference for Seena's think-aloud tool — study how they handle real-time AI augmentation of think-aloud protocols.

title: Feedback by Design: Understanding and Overcoming User Feedback Barriers in Conversational Agents
relevance: Why users struggle to give useful feedback to AI agents and how to design around it — critical for both Seena's AI interviewer and Brain Space's personal AI.

title: Scaffolded Vulnerability: Chatbot-Mediated Reciprocal Self-Disclosure and Need-Supportive Interaction in Couples
relevance: Chatbot-mediated vulnerability between partners — validates the original 3rd Brain thesis and directly informs Brain Space's shared spaces feature.

title: Cocoa: Co-Planning and Co-Execution with AI Agents
relevance: Human-AI co-planning and co-execution — maps directly onto Brain Space's AI-assisted task management and Seena's agent orchestration patterns.

title: Scaffolding Metacognition with GenAI: Design Opportunities to Support Task Management for University Students with ADHD
relevance: GenAI scaffolding executive function and task management — overlaps Brain Space's core value prop of 'making brain space' and connects to NYU accessibility work.

title: Prototyping Digital Social Spaces through Metaphor-Driven Design
relevance: Designing digital social spaces using spatial metaphors — Brain Space is literally organized around 'spaces' as areas of life. This explores the design vocabulary you're building with.

title: RELATE-Sim: Leveraging Turning Point Theory and LLM Agents to Predict Long-Term Relationship Dynamics
relevance: LLM agents simulating long-term relationship evolution — future Seena application for simulating user-company relationship dynamics over time.
note: Future Seena direction — could we simulate a person's relationship to a company or product over time?

title: The AI Memory Gap: Users Misremember What They Created With AI or Without
relevance: People can't accurately remember which parts they wrote vs. the AI — rich implications for authorship, agency, and what 'your work' means in an AI era.

title: AI Personalization Paradox: Personalized AI Increases Superficial Engagement in Reading while Undermines Autonomy and Ownership in Writing
relevance: Personalization helps reading but hurts writing — a design tension to unpack, especially as Brain Space personalizes AI to individual users.

title: The AI Genie Phenomenon and Three Types of AI Chatbot Addiction: Escapist Roleplays, Pseudosocial Companions, and Epistemic Rabbit Holes
relevance: Taxonomy of chatbot addiction patterns — provocative design ethics angle and consideration for any AI-forward product you're building.

title: Relational Dissonance in Human-AI Interactions: The Case of Knowledge Work
relevance: The tension when AI relationships don't fit existing social categories — you live this daily across both ventures. Strong content angle.

title: Exploring The Impact Of Proactive Generative AI Agent Roles In Time-Sensitive Collaborative Problem-Solving
relevance: What happens when AI agents take initiative vs. waiting for instructions — relevant to Brain Space's proactive task management and Seena's agent orchestration.

title: AI and My Values: User Perceptions of LLMs' Ability to Extract, Embody, and Explain Human Values from Casual Conversations
relevance: Can an LLM understand your values from how you talk? Connects to Brain Space's on-device AI learning about users and to the NAVP design framework (Needs, Abilities, Values, Preferences).
note: Potential connection to NAVP (Needs, Abilities, Values, Preferences) design framework — how might value extraction inform the V in NAVP?

title: Who Does What? Archetypes of Roles Assigned to LLMs During Human-AI Decision-Making
relevance: Maps the different roles people assign to LLMs (advisor, executor, collaborator) — directly informs Seena's agent mode design and strong 'Everything is Designed' content.

title: Research Slop
relevance: Names the central risk for AI research platforms like Seena — surface-level AI-generated insights replacing genuine understanding. Both a warning and a design brief.
